issue.title: [Query] showing last value at end
issue.body:
Hello,
Is there is any way to achieve this functions with plugin.
![Screenshot 2023-10-26 at 11 36 59 PM](https://github.com/leeoniya/uPlot/assets/438259/4505e952-383d-45f7-bc21-a90370bb2396)

Need to display the last value of the line at the end of the chart.

Thanks.

comment.body: see the source of this demo: https://leeoniya.github.io/uPlot/demos/area-fill.html

issue.title: [Query] showing last value at end
issue.body:
Hello,
Is there is any way to achieve this functions with plugin.
![Screenshot 2023-10-26 at 11 36 59 PM](https://github.com/leeoniya/uPlot/assets/438259/4505e952-383d-45f7-bc21-a90370bb2396)

Need to display the last value of the line at the end of the chart.

Thanks.

comment.body:
> yes it's possible, but probably needs extra logic to avoid overlap when the values are similar.
> 
> it is probably easier to just move the y axis to the right side. (or make a duplicate axis on the right side)
> 
> you can also use the legend to display the most recent value when nothing is being hovered.

Thanks @leeoniya for good suggestions, any reference for  achieving this "you can also use the legend to display the most recent value when nothing is being hovered."

issue.title: [Query] showing last value at end
issue.body:
Hello,
Is there is any way to achieve this functions with plugin.
![Screenshot 2023-10-26 at 11 36 59 PM](https://github.com/leeoniya/uPlot/assets/438259/4505e952-383d-45f7-bc21-a90370bb2396)

Need to display the last value of the line at the end of the chart.

Thanks.

comment.body:
yes it's possible, but probably needs extra logic to avoid overlap when the values are similar.

it is probably easier to just move the y axis to the right side.

you can also use the legend to display the most recent value when nothing is being hovered.

Thanks.

issue.title: Preserve selection
issue.body:
Firstly thanks for this amazing library. 

I've been trying to preserve selection when I've got `cursor.drag.setScale = false` in a sync'd ranger.
I had a look at the https://leeoniya.github.io/uPlot/demos/zoom-ranger.html demo, 
and once a selection is made, if you click anywhere else, the selection is reset in the ranger.

Is there an easy way to prevent that reset? I've tried setting `cursor.bind.click` to `() => null`, but that didn't work.

comment.body:
I was wondering if this a better alternative would be to cache the selection
and have a configuration option to preserve the selection such that when it's enabled, it wouldn't do a `hideSelect()`
https://github.com/leeoniya/uPlot/blob/38f63de6843d64e703fa23596d9525c15d003ecd/src/uPlot.js#L2916

That way we can restore the cached selection if there is a cancel mid selection? (eg: Escape modified during a mouseup?) or if the width of the new selection is 0

issue.title: Legend: only show X and focused serie
issue.body:
Hello,

Is it possible to only show legend for X value and the focused serie ? Something similar to this https://leeoniya.github.io/uPlot/demos/focus-cursor.html but instead of modifying opacity hide the entry in legend.

thanks !

comment.body: should be possible by using the `setSeries` hook and using the callback to update the legend items' DOM with `display: none`.

issue.title: make it possible to indicate multiple x and y facets in mode 2
issue.body:
for scale ranging, 2d objects like heatmap cells can have xMin xMax yMin yMax facets that should be used for finding scale range. currently only a single x and y facet is used, leading to clipping of data.

https://github.com/leeoniya/uPlot/blob/38f63de6843d64e703fa23596d9525c15d003ecd/src/uPlot.js#L1323-L1330

issue.title: Preserve selection
issue.body:
Firstly thanks for this amazing library. 

I've been trying to preserve selection when I've got `cursor.drag.setScale = false` in a sync'd ranger.
I had a look at the https://leeoniya.github.io/uPlot/demos/zoom-ranger.html demo, 
and once a selection is made, if you click anywhere else, the selection is reset in the ranger.

Is there an easy way to prevent that reset? I've tried setting `cursor.bind.click` to `() => null`, but that didn't work.
